001package com.technototes.library.hardware.servo;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.PwmControl;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.ServoImplEx;
005import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
006import com.technototes.library.general.Invertable;
007import com.technototes.library.hardware.HardwareDevice;
008import com.technototes.library.hardware.Sensored;
009
010/**
011 * Class for servos
012 * There's some useful functionality in here, but it can be added more easily by making something
013 * that direction extends the robotcore Servo instead. The HardwareDevice base class just adds
014 * a layer of indirection without much value...
015 *
016 * @author Alex Stedman
017 */
018@Deprecated
019@SuppressWarnings("unused")
020public class Servo
021    extends HardwareDevice<com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Servo>
022    implements Sensored, Invertable<Servo> {
023
024    private boolean inverted = false;
025
026    /**
027     * Create servo object
028     *
029     * @param device The servo
030     */
031    public Servo(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Servo device) {
032        super(device);
033    }
034
035    /**
036     * Create servo object
037     *
038     * @param deviceName The device name in hardware map
039     */
040    public Servo(String deviceName) {
041        super(deviceName);
042    }
043
044    /**
045     * Set position for the servo and return this
046     *
047     * @param position The servo position
048     * @return this
049     */
050    public Servo startAt(double position) {
051        setPosition(position);
052        return this;
053    }
054
055    public Servo scalePWM(double min, double max) {
056        if (getDevice() instanceof ServoImplEx) ((ServoImplEx) getDevice()).setPwmRange(
057                new PwmControl.PwmRange(min, max)
058            );
059        return this;
060    }
061
062    public Servo expandedRange() {
063        return scalePWM(500, 2500);
064    }
065
066    @Override
067    public boolean getInverted() {
068        return inverted;
069    }
070
071    @Override
072    public Servo setInverted(boolean invert) {
073        inverted = invert;
074        return this;
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Set servo position
079     *
080     * @param position The position to set the servo to
081     */
082    public void setPosition(double position) {
083        device.setPosition(Range.clip(!inverted ? position : 1 - position, 0, 1));
084    }
085
086    public void incrementPosition(double incAmount) {
087        setPosition(getPosition() + incAmount);
088    }
089
090    @Override
091    public double getSensorValue() {
092        return inverted ? 1 - device.getPosition() : device.getPosition();
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Get servo position
097     *
098     * @return The servo position
099     */
100    public double getPosition() {
101        return getSensorValue();
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Set servo range
106     *
107     * @param min The minimum of the range
108     * @param max The maximum of the range
109     * @return this
110     */
111    public Servo onRange(double min, double max) {
112        getDevice().scaleRange(min, max);
113        return this;
114    }
115}
